message: When was the story "Frankenstein; Or, The Modern Prometheus" first published?
According to the text, the story was first published on October 1, 1993.
Who is responsible for creating the HTML version of the eBook?
According to the text, the HTML version was created by Al Haines.
What is the narrator's impression of the pole?
The narrator is inspired by the wind of promise and imagines the pole as a region of beauty and delight.
What is the narrator's intention for the voyage?
The narrator intends to conquer all fear of danger or death and to commence the laborious voyage with joy, in order to discover new lands and observe celestial phenomena.
What was the source of the narrator's early fascination?
The history of all the voyages made for purposes of discovery composed Uncle Thomas' library.
What was the narrator's dream before inheriting his cousin's fortune?
To embark on an expedition to the North Pacific Ocean through the seas surrounding the pole.
What did the narrator do to demonstrate his skills and abilities to his captain?
The narrator hired himself as an under-mate in a Greenland whaler and acquitted himself to admiration.
How did the narrator feel about the prospect of embarking on a long and difficult voyage?
The narrator's hopes fluctuate, and his spirits are often depressed.
How many months did Walton intend to sail for in his expedition?
According to the letter, Walton intended to sail for "many, many months, perhaps years" (Letter 1).
What is the one thing that Walton feels he lacks in his expedition, despite having hired a vessel and collected sailors?
Walton feels he lacks a friend who can participate in his joy during times of success, and sustain him in dejection during times of disappointment (Letter 2).
